N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 406.4 - Child care review service

State Regulations
(a) The child care review service reporting
requirements are as follows: (1)

To assist in
providing and monitoring the foster care of children, adoptive services to
children, preventive services to children and families, and protective services
to children and families as a result of an indicated report of child abuse and
maltreatment, a statewide management assistance system is established, to be
called the State child care review service. (2)

As used in this section, foster
care
shall mean care provided to children away from their own homes on
a full-time basis, whether temporarily or for a prolonged period, in a foster
family free or boarding home, group home, agency boarding home, child care
institution or any combination thereof. Included are children placed in care
outside of New York State. (3)

Social services districts and authorized voluntary agencies shall submit to the
department, or to any person, firm, organization or association under contract
to the department for the design, implementation or operation of any part of
the child care review service, all information that is appropriate to the
purposes and operation of the service, including updating information in the
form and manner and at such times as the department may require. Notes
